page.title: 10HOUSES
page.content: There are about 200 houses in this small village situated round the head of the Eden Estuary between the Motray Water and the River Eden itself. The bridges across the rivers gave the village its name. Near the 2 bridges are the oldest houses, built of stone and some at least with red pantiled roofs. Along Main Street which links the 2 bridges, terraced houses, 3 storeys tall occupy the west side while the east side has the Paper Mill and its associated waste land. Also in Main Street is a former church, recently converted into a house. Within the last 30 years about 40 houses have been built on a flat site just North of the Motray Water. Otherwise little has changed and no new building is in progress.
